subject: Re: For the Skeptics
author: Jeff
full_text:
Hi Frank,
Have you posted the schematic of the TRF circuit? I may have missed this if so. Would be interested to see it. Presume you used the MK484 TRF chip?
Incidentally, I heard comment a while ago that the Minibox uses the MK484 chip.
JEFF

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>
>  If all this EVP stuff is imagination, how come I don't hear squat for ghost
> voices in the audio from the TRF radios? The audio is loud and clear, and
> broadcast fragments easily decernable, but few, if any ghost voices. I
> thought I got some with a single tuner, but with the double tuner--nothin'!
> 
>  I have to wonder if the down conversion process in the standard radio
> design is part of the box EVP. In super hetrodyne radios, the original RF
> signal is converted to a lower fixed frequency, usually 455khz. So just
> providing the raw audio seems to be only part of the box functions, the
> other tuned circuits must play a parts--the IF transformers being tuned
> circuits, plus the antenna, and the oscillator. Somethin' th think about!
> 
>  I tried an LA1135 chip this morning, same as the car tuners use, and it
> sounds like a car tuner--so it's back to the LM3820.
> 
> F-S
>
